          xS = sum(xControl), nS = length(xControl),

                    		
                  

                  

                    265
                    !
                    
                      
          Nmax = NmaxActive, NmaxControl = NmaxControl,

                    		
                  

                  

                    266
                    !
                    
                      
          delta = delta,

                    		
                  

                  

                    267
                    !
                    
                      
          thetaT = tT,

                    		
                  

                  

                    268
                    !
                    
                      
          parE = parE,

                    		
                  

                  

                    269
                    !
                    
                      
          weights = weights,

                    		
                  

                  

                    270
                    !
                    
                      
          parS = parS

                    		
                  

                  

                    271
                    !
                    
                      
        )$result

                    		
                  

                  

                    272
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    273
                    
                    
                      
        ## sample sizes: in both arms

                    		
                  

                  

                    274
                    !
                    
                      
        nActive[k] <- length(xActive)

                    		
                  

                  

                    275
                    !
                    
                      
        nControl[k] <- length(xControl)

                    		
                  

                  

                    276
                    
                    
                      
      }

                    		
                  

                  

                    277
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    278
                    
                    
                      
      ## decision depends on whether Bayes or PP is used:

                    		
                  

                  

                    279
                    !
                    
                      
      s[k] <- if (method %in% bayesNames) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    280
                    !
                    
                      
        ifelse(qU >= tU, TRUE, ifelse(qL >= tL, FALSE, NA))

                    		
                  

                  

                    281
                    
                    
                      
      } else {

                    		
                  

                  

                    282
                    !
                    
                      
        ifelse(q >= phiU & !(i < Nmax & phiU == 1),

                    		
                  

                  

                    283
                    !
                    
                      
          TRUE,

                    		
                  

                  

                    284
                    !
                    
                      
          ifelse(q <= phiL, FALSE, NA)

                    		
                  

                  

                    285
                    
                    
                      
        )

                    		
                  

                  

                    286
                    
                    
                      
      }

                    		
                  

                  

                    287
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    288
                    
                    
                      
      ## advance iterators

                    		
                  

                  

                    289
                    !
                    
                      
      n[k] <- i

                    		
                  

                  

                    290
                    !
                    
                      
      j <- j + 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    291
                    !
                    
                      
      i <- nnr[j]

                    		
                  

                  

                    292
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    293
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    294
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    295
                    !
                    
                      
  oc <- cbind(

                    		
                  

                  

                    296
                    !
                    
                      
    ExpectedN = mean(n),

                    		
                  

                  

                    297
                    !
                    
                      
    ExpectedNactive = mean(nActive),

                    		
                  

                  

                    298
                    !
                    
                      
    ExpectedNcontrol = mean(nControl),

                    		
                  

                  

                    299
                    !
                    
                      
    PrStopEarly = mean(n < Nmax),

                    		
                  

                  

                    300
                    !
                    
                      
    PrEarlyEff = sum(s * (n < Nmax), na.rm = TRUE) / nSim,

                    		
                  

                  

                    301
                    !
                    
                      
    PrEarlyFut = sum((1 - s) * (n < Nmax), na.rm = TRUE) / nSim,

                    		
                  

                  

                    302
                    !
                    
                      
    PrEfficacy = sum(s, na.rm = TRUE) / nSim,

                    		
                  

                  

                    303
                    !
                    
                      
    PrFutility = sum(1 - s, na.rm = TRUE) / nSim,

                    		
                  

                  

                    304
                    !
                    
                      
    PrGrayZone = sum(is.na(s) / nSim)

                    		
                  

                  

                    305
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    306
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    307
                    
                    
                      
  ## return OC

                    		
                  

                  

                    308
                    !
                    
                      
  return(oc)

                    		
                  

                  

                    309
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Decision cutpoints for boundary (based on posterior probability)

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description `r lifecycle::badge("experimental")`

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' This function is used to identify the efficacy and futility

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' boundaries based on the following rules:

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' Efficacy boundary: find minimum x (xU) where Pr(RR > p1 | x, n, a, b) >= tU and

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' Futility boundary: find maximum x (xL) where Pr(RR < p0 | x, n, a, b) >= tL

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams postprob

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams ocPostprob

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed looks : numeric

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'  A vector of number of patients in each look.

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A matrix for each same size in `looks`. For each sample size, the following is returned:

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' - `xL` : the maximum number of responses that meet the futility threshold.

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' - `pL` : response rate corresponding to `xL`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' - `postL`: posterior probability corresponding to `xL`, i.e. Pr(RR < p0 | xL, n, a, b).

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#' - `pL_upper_ci` : upper bound of one sided 95% CI for the response rate `pL` based on an

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'            exact binomial test.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' - `xU` : the minimal number of responses that meet the efficacy threshold.

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' - `pU` : response rate corresponding to `xU`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' - `postU` : posterior probability corresponding to `xU`, i.e. Pr(RR > p1 |xU, n, a, b).

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' - `pU_lower_ci` : lower bound of one sided 95% CI for the response rate `pU` based on exact

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#'            binomial test.

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' @example examples/boundsPostprob.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
boundsPostprob <- function(looks, p0, p1 = p0, tL, tU, parE = c(1, 1), weights) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    2x
                    
                      
  assert_numeric(looks, any.missing = FALSE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    2x
                    
                      
  assert_number(p0, lower = 0, upper = 1)

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    2x
                    
                      
  assert_number(p1, lower = 0, upper = 1)

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    2x
                    
                      
  assert_number(tL, lower = 0, upper = 1)

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    2x
                    
                      
  assert_number(tU, lower = 0, upper = 1)

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    2x
                    
                      
  assert_numeric(parE, min.len = 2, any.missing = FALSE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    2x
                    
                      
  znames <- c(

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    2x
                    
                      
    "xL", "pL", "postL", "pL_upper_ci",

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    2x
                    
                      
    "xU", "pU", "postU", "pU_lower_ci"

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    2x
                    
                      
  z <- matrix(NA, nrow = length(looks), ncol = length(znames))

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    2x
                    
                      
  dimnames(z) <- list(looks, znames)

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    2x
                    
                      
  k <- 0

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    2x
                    
                      
  parE <- t(parE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    2x
                    
                      
  if (missing(weights)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    1x
                    
                      
    weights <- rep(1, nrow(parE))

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    2x
                    
                      
  assert_numeric(weights, min.len = 0, len = nrow(par), finite = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    2x
                    
                      
  for (n in looks) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    7x
                    
                      
    k <- k + 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    
                    
                      
    # initialize so will return NA if 0 or n in "continue" region

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    7x
                    
                      
    xL <- NA

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    7x
                    
                      
    xU <- NA

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    7x
                    
                      
    for (x in 0:n) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    48x
                    
                      
      postp_fut <- 1 - postprob(x = x, n = n, p = p0, parE = parE, weights = weights) # futility look

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    48x
                    
                      
      if (postp_fut >= tL) { # Rule is P(RR < p0) > tL

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    22x
                    
                      
        postL <- postp_fut

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    22x
                    
                      
        xL <- x

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    
                    
                      
      }

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    48x
                    
                      
      postp_eff <- postprob(x = x, n = n, p = p1, parE = parE, weights = weights) # efficacy look

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    48x
                    
                      
      if (postp_eff >= tU) { # Rule is P(RR > p1) > tU

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    7x
                    
                      
        postU <- postp_eff

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    7x
                    
                      
        xU <- x

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    7x
                    
                      
        break

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    
                    
                      
      }

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    
                    
                      
    # calculate lower CI at boundaries

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    7x
                    
                      
    pL_upper_ci <- ifelse(!is.na(xL), stats::binom.test(xL, n, alt = "less")$conf.int[2], NA)

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    7x
                    
                      
    pU_lower_ci <- ifelse(!is.na(xU), stats::binom.test(xU, n, alt = "greater")$conf.int[1], NA)

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    7x
                    
                      
    z[k, ] <- c(

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    7x
                    
                      
      xL,

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    7x
                    
                      
      xL / n,

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    7x
                    
                      
      postL,

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    7x
                    
                      
      pL_upper_ci,

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    7x
                    
                      
      xU,

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    7x
                    
                      
      xU / n,

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    7x
                    
                      
      postU,

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    7x
                    
                      
      pU_lower_ci

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    2x
                    
                      
  round(data.frame(looks, z), 4)

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Return summary statistics under one response scenario

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' This function will calculate the summary statistics for a specific response

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' outcome scenario.

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams postprob

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams sumBetaDiff

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed round : number

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' Digit rounding of the output statistics

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A vector with the results.

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#' @example examples/sumTable.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
sumTable <- function(x,

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
                     n,

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
                     go_cut,

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
                     stop_cut,

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
                     parX,

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
                     parY = c(0.5, 0.5),

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
                     round = 2) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    4x
                    
                      
  assert_numeric(x, lower = 0, upper = n, finite = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    3x
                    
                      
  assert_number(n, lower = 0, finite = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    3x
                    
                      
  assert_number(go_cut, finite = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    3x
                    
                      
  assert_number(stop_cut, finite = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    3x
                    
                      
  assert_numeric(parY, len = 2, lower = .Machine$double.xmin, any.missing = FALSE, finite = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    3x
                    
                      
  assert_numeric(parX, len = 2, lower = .Machine$double.xmin, any.missing = FALSE, finite = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    2x
                    
                      
  assert_count(round)

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    2x
                    
                      
  tmp <- sumBetaDiff(

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    2x
                    
                      
    parX = parX,

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    2x
                    
                      
    parY =

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    2x
                    
                      
      c(

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    2x
                    
                      
        x + parY[1],

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    2x
                    
                      
        n - x + parY[2]

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
      ),

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    2x
                    
                      
    go_cut = go_cut,

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    2x
                    
                      
    stop_cut = stop_cut

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    2x
                    
                      
  summaries <- round(c(

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    2x
                    
                      
    x,

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    2x
                    
                      
    x / n * 100,

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    2x
                    
                      
    tmp$mode * 100,

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    2x
                    
                      
    tmp$ci * 100,

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    2x
                    
                      
    tmp$go * 100,

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    2x
                    
                      
    tmp$stop * 100

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    2x
                    
                      
  ), round)

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    2x
                    
                      
  summaries <- as.data.frame(summaries)

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    2x
                    
                      
  rownames(summaries) <- c(

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    2x
                    
                      
    "responders",

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    2x
                    
                      
    "obs ORR [%]",

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    2x
                    
                      
    "mode [%]",

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    2x
                    
                      
    "CI lower [%]",

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    2x
                    
                      
    "CI upper [%]",

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    2x
                    
                      
    "prob.go [%]",

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    2x
                    
                      
    "prob.nogo [%]"

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    2x
                    
                      
  summaries

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
##' Launch the ShinyPhase1b app

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
##'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
##' Launch the ShinyPhase1b app in the default web browser.

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
##'

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
##' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
runShinyPhase1b <- function() {

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    !
                    
                      
  appDir <- system.file("shinyapp", "ShinyPhase1b", package = "phase1b")

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    !
                    
                      
  if (appDir == "") {

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    !
                    
                      
    stop("Could not find phase1b app directory. Try re-installing `phase1b`.", call. = FALSE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    !
                    
                      
  shiny::runApp(appDir, display.mode = "normal")

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
# reference https://www.r-bloggers.com/supplementing-your-r-package-with-a-shiny-app-2/;

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' Decision cutpoints for boundary (based on predictive probability) for Decision 1 rule.

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' @description `r lifecycle::badge("experimental")`

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#' This function is used to identify the efficacy boundary and futility

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' boundary based on rules in @details.

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams predprob

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams ocPredprob

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams boundsPostprob

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A matrix for each same size in `looks`. For each sample size, the following is returned:

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' - `xL` : the maximum number of responses that meet the futility

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'          threshold.

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' - `pL` : response rate corresponding to `xL`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#' - `predL` : predictive probability corresponding to `xL`

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#' - `postL`: posterior probability corresponding to `xL`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' - `pL_upper_ci` : upper bound of one sided 95% CI for the response rate based on an

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#'            exact binomial test.

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#' - `xU` : the minimal number of responses that meet the efficacy threshold.

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#' - `pU` : response rate corresponding to `xU`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' - `predU` : predictive probability corresponding to `xU`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#' - `postU`: posterior probability corresponding to `xU`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#' - `pU_lower_ci` : lower bound of one sided 95% CI for the response rate based on exact

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#'            binomial test.

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' @importFrom stats binom.test

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' @details see also `predprob()`

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#' The following rules are Decision 1 rules:

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#' Efficacy boundary: find minimum x (xU) where

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' Pr(Pr(RR > p0 | data) >= tT | x) >= phiU,

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#' Futility boundary: find maximum x (xL) where

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#' Pr(Pr(RR > p0 | data) >= tT | x) =< phiL

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#' @example examples/boundsPredprob.R

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' @export

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
#' @keywords graphics

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
boundsPredprob <- function(looks, Nmax = max(looks), p0, tT, phiL, phiU, parE = c(1, 1), weights) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    3x
                    
                      
  assert_numeric(looks, any.missing = FALSE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    3x
                    
                      
  assert_number(p0, lower = 0, upper = 1)

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    3x
                    
                      
  assert_number(tT, lower = 0, upper = 1)

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    3x
                    
                      
  assert_number(phiL, lower = 0, upper = 1)

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    3x
                    
                      
  assert_number(phiU, lower = 0, upper = 1)

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    3x
                    
                      
  assert_numeric(parE, min.len = 2, any.missing = FALSE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    3x
                    
                      
  znames <- c(

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    3x
                    
                      
    "xL", "pL", "predL", "postL", "pL_upper_ci",

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    3x
                    
                      
    "xU", "pU", "predU", "postU", "pU_lower_ci"

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    3x
                    
                      
  z <- matrix(NA, length(looks), length(znames))

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    3x
                    
                      
  dimnames(z) <- list(looks, znames)

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    3x
                    
                      
  k <- 0

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    3x
                    
                      
  if (missing(weights)) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    1x
                    
                      
    weights <- rep(1, nrow(t(parE)))

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    3x
                    
                      
  assert_numeric(weights, min.len = 0, len = nrow(t(parE)), finite = TRUE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    3x
                    
                      
  for (n in looks) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    10x
                    
                      
    k <- k + 1

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    
                    
                      
    # initialize so will return NA if 0 or n in "continue" region

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    10x
                    
                      
    xL <- NA

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    10x
                    
                      
    xU <- NA

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    10x
                    
                      
    for (x in 0:n) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    83x
                    
                      
      predprob <- predprob(

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    83x
                    
                      
        x = x,

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    83x
                    
                      
        n = n,

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    83x
                    
                      
        Nmax = max(looks),

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    83x
                    
                      
        p = p0,

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    83x
                    
                      
        thetaT = tT,

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    83x
                    
                      
        parE = parE,

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    83x
                    
                      
        weights = weights

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    83x
                    
                      
      )$result

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    83x
                    
                      
      if (predprob <= phiL) { # Futility look, Rule Pr(Pr( RR > p0 | x, Y) >= tT | x) =< phiL

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    50x
                    
                      
        xL <- x

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    50x
                    
                      
        predL <- predprob

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    
                    
                      
      }

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    83x
                    
                      
      if (predprob >= phiU) { # Efficacy look, Rule Pr(Pr( RR > p0 | x, Y) >= tT | x) >= phiU,

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    10x
                    
                      
        xU <- x

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    10x
                    
                      
        predU <- predprob

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    10x
                    
                      
        break

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
      }

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      
    # reset xU to NA if phiU = 1 and n < Nmax

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    10x
                    
                      
    if (n < Nmax && phiU == 1) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    !
                    
                      
      xU <- NA

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      
    }

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      
    # calculate predictive and posterior probabilities at boundaries

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    10x
                    
                      
    postL <- postprob(x = xL, n = n, p = p0, parE = parE, weights = weights, log.p = FALSE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    10x
                    
                      
    postU <- postprob(x = xU, n = n, p = p0, parE = parE, weights = weights, log.p = FALSE)

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      
    # calculate lower CI at boundaries

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    10x
                    
                      
    pL_upper_ci <- ifelse(!is.na(xL), stats::binom.test(xL, n, alt = "less")$conf.int[2], NA)

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    10x
                    
                      
    pU_lower_ci <- ifelse(!is.na(xU), stats::binom.test(xU, n, alt = "greater")$conf.int[1], NA)

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    10x
                    
                      
    z[k, ] <- c(

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    10x
                    
                      
      xL,

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    10x
                    
                      
      xL / n,

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    10x
                    
                      
      predL,

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    10x
                    
                      
      postL,

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    10x
                    
                      
      pL_upper_ci,

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    10x
                    
                      
      xU,

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    10x
                    
                      
      xU / n,

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    10x
                    
                      
      predU,

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    10x
                    
                      
      postU,

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    10x
                    
                      
      pU_lower_ci

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    
                    
                      
  }

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    3x
                    
                      
  round(data.frame(looks, z), 4)

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                
              

            

            

              

                
                  

                    1
                    
                    
                      
#' The predictive probability of success in single arm studies.

                    		
                  

                  

                    2
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    3
                    
                    
                      
#' The helper function to generate the predictive probability of success based only on treatment group (`E`)

                    		
                  

                  

                    4
                    
                    
                      
#' as there is no control or standard of care (`S`), indicated by `NmaxControl == 0`.

                    		
                  

                  

                    5
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    6
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed x : number

                    		
                  

                  

                    7
                    
                    
                      
#'  number of successes in the `E` group at interim.

                    		
                  

                  

                    8
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed mE : number

                    		
                  

                  

                    9
                    
                    
                      
#'  number of successes in the remaining `Nmax-n` number of patients in the treatment `E` group.

                    		
                  

                  

                    10
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed Nmax : number

                    		
                  

                  

                    11
                    
                    
                      
#'   maximum number of patients in the `E` group at final analysis.

                    		
                  

                  

                    12
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed delta : number

                    		
                  

                  

                    13
                    
                    
                      
#'   difference between response rates to be met.

                    		
                  

                  

                    14
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed relativeDelta : flag

                    		
                  

                  

                    15
                    
                    
                      
#'  If `TRUE`, then a `relativeDelta` is used. Represents that a minimum

                    		
                  

                  

                    16
                    
                    
                      
#'  response rate in magnitude of `delta` of the `S` non-responding patients. See [postprobDist()].

                    		
                  

                  

                    17
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed parE : numeric

                    		
                  

                  

                    18
                    
                    
                      
#'  parameters for beta distribution. If it is a matrix, it needs to have 2 columns,

                    		
                  

                  

                    19
                    
                    
                      
#'  and each row corresponds to each component of a beta-mixture distribution

                    		
                  

                  

                    20
                    
                    
                      
#'  for the `E` group.

                    		
                  

                  

                    21
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed parS : numeric

                    		
                  

                  

                    22
                    
                    
                      
#'  parameters for beta distribution. If it is a matrix, it needs to have 2 columns,

                    		
                  

                  

                    23
                    
                    
                      
#'  and each row corresponds to each component of a beta-mixture distribution for the `S` group.

                    		
                  

                  

                    24
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed weights : numeric

                    		
                  

                  

                    25
                    
                    
                      
#'  the mixture weights of the beta mixture prior.

                    		
                  

                  

                    26
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed weightsS : numeric

                    		
                  

                  

                    27
                    
                    
                      
#'  weights for the `S` group.

                    		
                  

                  

                    28
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed thetaT : number

                    		
                  

                  

                    29
                    
                    
                      
#'  threshold on the probability to be used.

                    		
                  

                  

                    30
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    31
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A `list` is returned with names `result` for predictive probability and

                    		
                  

                  

                    32
                    
                    
                      
#'  `table` of numeric values with counts of responses in the remaining patients,

                    		
                  

                  

                    33
                    
                    
                      
#'  probabilities of these counts, corresponding probabilities to be above threshold,

                    		
                  

                  

                    34
                    
                    
                      
#'  and trial success indicators.

                    		
                  

                  

                    35
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    36
                    
                    
                      
#' @keywords internal

                    		
                  

                  

                    37
                    
                    
                      
h_predprobdist_single_arm <- function(x,

                    		
                  

                  

                    38
                    
                    
                      
                                      mE,

                    		
                  

                  

                    39
                    
                    
                      
                                      n,

                    		
                  

                  

                    40
                    
                    
                      
                                      Nmax,

                    		
                  

                  

                    41
                    
                    
                      
                                      delta,

                    		
                  

                  

                    42
                    
                    
                      
                                      relativeDelta,

                    		
                  

                  

                    43
                    
                    
                      
                                      parE,

                    		
                  

                  

                    44
                    
                    
                      
                                      parS,

                    		
                  

                  

                    45
                    
                    
                      
                                      weights,

                    		
                  

                  

                    46
                    
                    
                      
                                      weightsS,

                    		
                  

                  

                    47
                    
                    
                      
                                      thetaT) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    48
                    6x
                    
                      
  assert_number(x, lower = 0, upper = Nmax)

                    		
                  

                  

                    49
                    6x
                    
                      
  assert_number(mE, lower = 0)

                    		
                  

                  

                    50
                    6x
                    
                      
  assert_number(x + mE, upper = Nmax)

                    		
                  

                  

                    51
                    6x
                    
                      
  assert_number(thetaT, lower = 0, upper = 1)

                    		
                  

                  

                    52
                    6x
                    
                      
  posterior_y <- postprobDist(

                    		
                  

                  

                    53
                    6x
                    
                      
    x = x + c(0:mE),

                    		
                  

                  

                    54
                    6x
                    
                      
    n = Nmax,

                    		
                  

                  

                    55
                    6x
                    
                      
    delta = delta,

                    		
                  

                  

                    56
                    6x
                    
                      
    relativeDelta = relativeDelta,

                    		
                  

                  

                    57
                    6x
                    
                      
    parE = parE,

                    		
                  

                  

                    58
                    6x
                    
                      
    weights = weights,

                    		
                  

                  

                    59
                    6x
                    
                      
    parS = parS,

                    		
                  

                  

                    60
                    6x
                    
                      
    weightsS = weightsS

                    		
                  

                  

                    61
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    62
                    6x
                    
                      
  activeBetamixPost <- h_getBetamixPost(x = x, n = n, par = parE, weights = weights)

                    		
                  

                  

                    63
                    6x
                    
                      
  density_y <- with(

                    		
                  

                  

                    64
                    6x
                    
                      
    activeBetamixPost,

                    		
                  

                  

                    65
                    6x
                    
                      
    dbetabinomMix(x = 0:mE, m = mE, par = par, weights = weights)

                    		
                  

                  

                    66
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    67
                    6x
                    
                      
  list(

                    		
                  

                  

                    68
                    6x
                    
                      
    result = sum(density_y * (posterior_y > thetaT)),

                    		
                  

                  

                    69
                    6x
                    
                      
    table = data.frame(

                    		
                  

                  

                    70
                    6x
                    
                      
      counts = c(0:mE),

                    		
                  

                  

                    71
                    6x
                    
                      
      cumul_counts = x + (0:mE),

                    		
                  

                  

                    72
                    6x
                    
                      
      density = density_y,

                    		
                  

                  

                    73
                    6x
                    
                      
      posterior = posterior_y,

                    		
                  

                  

                    74
                    6x
                    
                      
      success = (posterior_y > thetaT)

                    		
                  

                  

                    75
                    
                    
                      
    )

                    		
                  

                  

                    76
                    
                    
                      
  )

                    		
                  

                  

                    77
                    
                    
                      
}

                    		
                  

                  

                    78
                    
                    
                      

                    		
                  

                  

                    79
                    
                    
                      
#' The predictive probability of success in two-arm studies.

                    		
                  

                  

                    80
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    81
                    
                    
                      
#' The helper function to generate the predictive probability of success

                    		
                  

                  

                    82
                    
                    
                      
#' based on the difference in treatment group (`E`) and control or

                    		
                  

                  

                    83
                    
                    
                      
#' standard of care (`S`) group.

                    		
                  

                  

                    84
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    85
                    
                    
                      
#' @inheritParams h_predprobdist_single_arm

                    		
                  

                  

                    86
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    87
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed xS : number

                    		
                  

                  

                    88
                    
                    
                      
#'  number of successes in the `S` group at interim.

                    		
                  

                  

                    89
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed n : number

                    		
                  

                  

                    90
                    
                    
                      
#'  number of patients in the `E` group at interim.

                    		
                  

                  

                    91
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed nS : number

                    		
                  

                  

                    92
                    
                    
                      
#'  number of patients in the `E` group at interim.

                    		
                  

                  

                    93
                    
                    
                      
#' @typed NmaxControl : number

                    		
                  

                  

                    94
                    
                    
                      
#'   maximum number of patients in the `S` group at final analysis.

                    		
                  

                  

                    95
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    96
                    
                    
                      
#' @return A `list` is returned with names `result` for predictive probability and

                    		
                  

                  

                    97
                    
                    
                      
#'  `table` of numeric values with counts of responses in the remaining patients, `density` for

                    		
                  

                  

                    98
                    
                    
                      
#'  probabilities of these counts, `posterior` for corresponding probabilities to be above threshold,

                    		
                  

                  

                    99
                    
                    
                      
#'  and `success`for trial success indicators.

                    		
                  

                  

                    100
                    
                    
                      
#'

                    		
                  

                  

                    101
                    
                    
                      
#' @keywords internal

                    		
                  

                  

                    102
                    
                    
                      
h_predprobdist <- function(x,

                    		
                  

                  

                    103
                    
                    
                      
                           n,

                    		
                  

                  

                    104
                    
                    
                      
                           xS,

                    		
                  

                  

                    105
                    
                    
                      
                           nS,

                    		
                  

                  

                    106
                    
                    
                      
                           Nmax,

                    		
                  

                  

                    107
                    
                    
                      
                           NmaxControl,

                    		
                  

                  

                    108
                    
                    
                      
                           delta,

                    		
                  

                  

                    109
                    
                    
                      
                           relativeDelta,

                    		
                  

                  

                    110
                    
                    
                      
                           parE,

                    		
                  

                  

                    111
                    
                    
                      
                           parS,

                    		
                  

                  

                    112
                    
                    
                      
                           weights,

                    		
                  

                  

                    113
                    
                    
                      
                           weightsS,

                    		
                  

                  

                    114
                    
                    
                      
                           thetaT) {

                    		
                  

                  

                    115
                    1522x
